comments.commentBody:
"This is Nixon/Watergate. Bad (or sick) guy!"

Is he looking in a mirror? Now he's drifting into Nixon-level paranoia.

Do not waste your frustration on the Republican Party.  They want Trump to succeed because with his Presidency they are getting their appointments and policies in place.  Get angry at our Congressional Democrats who are weak and ineffective.  We need tough and bold leadership to combat Trump... and as of now, we don't have it.

Just when I think, Trump can't embarrass himself and this country any more than he already has, he stoops lower again. He has to be mentally ill, no doubt about it. He is starting these stupid rumors to take the focus of himself and his joke of an administration, but doesn't realize that joke is on himself. I have said it before, and saying it gain, he feels so inferior next to President Obama, that he is willing to do and say anything to make himself feel better. Get a life, DJT!

Unfortunately, many of the people who voted for him have similar personalities, and are probably seeing a reflection of themselves. Abusive, aggressive, violent, foul-mouthed, ignorant, vengeful, vindictive ... probably not all, but you can bet many do. They like him because he's just like them, but with lots of money.

Why are you reporting such an obvious attempt to divert attention from his and his team's communications with Russia.  This is proof that investigators are getting too close for his comfort and that He colluded with Russia. The election should be negated and a new election held.

The only reason Trump appeared presidential is because he was reading a teleprompter. He has a history of lying and blaming anything not going his way on others, and he cannot admit when he is wrong, no matter how obvious. His coaching goes back to his father, his notorious lawyer associate Roy Cohn, and the manner in which he conducted his real estate dealing. When things are going down for Donald Trump, it is everybody else's fault; so you are correct in that we are dealing with a middle school mentality. In order to guarantee a victory in the 2016 election, Mr. Trump used below the belt tactics typical of the Republican party when they have their backs against the wall, but Trump took these tactics to a whole new level. He went so far as to suggest to the Russians to hack email servers, to which they complied and proceeded to let Mr. Trump in on the gig. I can see Trump now dancing a jig reminiscent of Hitler when he was informed of the leaks on the DNC. Now the entire gig is beginning to fall apart as more and more information is coming out, while the Russians are waiting for their favor of having sanctions to be relieved. How is the Donald going to get everyone to listen to him so he can pay off his favor to the Russians? Will the Russian ambassador crack? Will Putin fall off his chair laughing at the ineptitude of Trump and the US? Stay tuned for the continuing episode of "Megalomaniac in the White House!"

Since Trump does not understand the laws of this country, it has become apparent that if he was tapped, then either he or someone in his tower was acting in an illegal manner towards the United States of America.   The Foreign Intelligence Court would have to have unsurmountable evidence to require and enable surveillance.   Duh. Not Obama.  Intelligence would warrant this.     Is Trump that stupid?    You betcha.  Either he just implicated himself or as usual, deflecting from the fact that his several in his cabinet have lied to Congress.

We have gone beyond the realm of the absurd to enter the one of lunacy... This has to stop! To the Republicans, it is time for you to show, how you put your country ahead of your party, or you will be remembered as the party who betrayed America for self interest. To the Democrats, you must unfortunately take a page from the tea party handbook, and learn how to be single minded, intransigeant obstructionists. We need new elections, maybe a new constitution, but we definitely need to rid ourselves of our political establishment, who forgot that they are here to serve us and not themselves.
Trump is releasing another rabbit to get the conversation away from him being the Siberian Candidate. Nice try

It's so obvious that Trump is an unhinged manipulator and wants to play the American public like we are fickle viewers of a reality show. When one story line (Russia) gets too heavy and dominates too much attention/air space, throw another random unfounded claim to incense his base and fluster news reporters. This is a distraction tactic. I hope this is the last article on this nonsense. Any more attention to this foolishness is playing right into the hands of this maniac.

The audience on "The Apprentice" was basically a passive and receptive audience. His audience as President is his undoing—cannot control politicians like you control clients and vendors. Who would trust a man whose hairstyle looks like a U-turn?
No, Maureen -- articles like this, providing evidence that Trump is misguided, are very important and are not a "distraction."  Don't worry about it.
NO, the Times must report on all Trump's foolishness and make it part of the public record.

It is apparent that dt is completely controlled and influenced by bannon and the breirbart crowd.  His intellectual abilities have always been suspect but it's finally clear that he has no capacity for even rational thought.  Will good Republicans please stand up and put an end to this?

Tell me readers, that you did not see this coming. Classic misdirection Trump...send everyone into the direction of the Obama wiretap story and hand the Russian ball off to Sessions into the spin zone. Should add, cannot wait for all the Republicans on Sunday news shows asking for an immediate, Benghazi like hearing over the Obama wiretaps---you can't make this stuff up anymore.
I have more confidence in the republican leadership than you do, ACJ.  They may not be denouncing Trump's latest craziness, but I strongly doubt they will support it.   They know the end is near.

None of us know the facts here.Yet the Trump antagonists have already decided he's lying/delusional.Obama would never personally order a phone tap.His subordinates such as Rice/Jarrett/Brennan certainly would have.Lets see what the facts are before rushing to conclusions.I don't trust either Trump or Obama on this allegation.

it's odd, Bruce, that while you say that "none of us" have facts, you do seem to know that Obama's subordinates would order a phone tap.

How can that be?

In the fact-based world, it is the asserter's obligation to substantiate the assertion.

Trump accused Obama of spying on Trump. Thus it is solely Trump's obligation to provide evidence. It is not anyone else's obligation to disprove him.

So if Trump can not provide supporting evidence, then yeah, he pretty much is "lying/delusional".
Bud does not seem very trustworthy either.
To paraphrase Ms. Doud's last sentence, "It will always be too soon to laugh about djt as President."

And this all came as a surprise to Trump because he hadn't seen it on Fox or CNN? Of course, Trump assumed that Obama was doing nothing to combat North Korea because he hadn't seen Obama launch any missiles or military attacks.

You're basically stating the obvious without any suggestions about how to accomplish it. The first challenge (refugees) is significant but surmountable. But the second challenge is basically impossible. It doesn't matter whether the US abrogates the alliance with South Korea and removes its troops. It will still sell arms to Seoul, both countries will still have diplomats and defense attaches in each other's embassies coordinating foreign and defense policy, and, perhaps most importantly, both the South and North Korean people will feel grateful toward the US and have a very low opinion of China. You can't change the fact that China would still feel surrounded by US allies in the region, even if a unified Korea weren't technically a US treaty ally.
Now that's a movie I would watch
Excellent analysis.
"No more than ten to twenty million killed...depending on the breaks."

The core issue between the US and China, from the Chinese perspective, is Taiwan. So talking about Chinese cooperation on other issues where are interests are not aligned, like NK, or the South China Sea without even mentioning Taiwan may give the reader a false sense of optimism on how likely it is that China and the US will come to an agreement on easing the threat posed by NK to the US.
It's unsettling that all of us who read this article already know more about and have more interest in North Korea's nukes than does Trump.

So, why would a small nuclear power attack a super nuclear power?  Does North Korea's government believe that the USA would not counter-attack because of the geographical nearness of South Korea, meaning that an attack on one would also harm the other?
So your position is that only Republicans ignore previous administration's policies?
No need to worry, the country club set is well-versed in matters of national security.
Maybe I'm trying to call his bluff...
